page.title: 06CARNEGIE LIBRARY
page.content: The library,sited on Ormskirk Road, has approximately 50,000 books.It was opened on December 11th 1907.It was one of many buildings funded by the philanthropist Andrew Carnegie.A stone plaque embedded in the brickwork at the front of the library reads,"{THIS {PUBLIC LIBRARY WAS PRESENTED BY ANDREW {CARNEGIE L.L.D. AND WAS OPENED BY LORD {BALCARRES M.P.ON THE ELEVENTH DAY OF {DECEMBER NINETEEN HUNDRED AND SEVEN.}" At the time of opening,the Chief Librarian was Henry Tennyson Folkard and the mayor was Sam Wood.In addition to its use as a library,the building houses reception rooms.It is used as a polling station for both council and parliamentary elections.
